name: SPDR S&P/ASX 200 Fund
description: The SPDR S&P/ASX 200 Fund (EWA) is an exchange-traded fund that seeks to provide investment results that correspond generally to the price and yield performance of the S&P/ASX 200 Index, which comprises 200 of the largest companies listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. Launched in 2001, EWA offers investors exposure to a diverse range of sectors including financials, materials, healthcare, consumer discretionary, and more, making it an effective way to gain broad exposure to the Australian equity market. By investing in EWA, investors can capitalize on the growth potential of the Australian economy and benefit from the performance of large-cap companies such as Commonwealth Bank, BHP Group, and CSL Limited. The fund is designed for investors seeking a low-cost, passive investment strategy that allows them to participate in the performance of Australian equities without the need to select individual stocks. EWA is managed by State Street Global Advisors, one of the world's largest asset managers, ensuring a high level of expertise and oversight in fund management. As a registered investment vehicle, EWA is also subject to regulatory oversight, providing investors with a level of confidence and security in their investment. Overall, the SPDR S&P/ASX 200 Fund is an attractive option for both domestic and international investors looking to diversify their portfolios and gain exposure to the Australian market.

seo.meta_title: SPDR S&P/ASX 200 Fund (EWA) | Australian Equities ETF
seo.meta_description: Invest in the SPDR S&P/ASX 200 Fund (EWA) for exposure to the largest Australian companies. Discover how EWA can diversify your investment portfolio.

faq.question: What is EWA?
faq.answer: EWA is an exchange-traded fund that aims to track the performance of the S&P/ASX 200 Index.

faq.question: Who manages the EWA fund?
faq.answer: The EWA fund is managed by State Street Global Advisors.

faq.question: What kind of exposure does EWA provide?
faq.answer: EWA provides exposure to 200 of the largest companies on the Australian Securities Exchange.
